title: The next phase of FIFA’s World Cup ticket availability begins soon. Here’s how to sign up.
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: World Cup The third phase of FIFA World Cup ticket sales will be the first to happen following Friday's "Final Draw," meaning that fans will largely know which teams are set to play in the group stage games.
The FIFA World Cup 2026 Countdown Clock next to Faneuil Hall in Boston in June.

Pat Greenhouse/ The Boston Globe Staff By Hayden Bird December 5, 2025 | 1:05 PM 2 minutes to read The latest step in the buildup to the FIFA 2026 World Cup — Friday’s “Final Draw” — is set to determine the all-important match-ups and pathways that nations will navigate when the competition itself kicks off in June, 2026.

title: Are Patriots true Super Bowl contenders? They must correct these flaws first
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots need to shore up their red-zone execution moving forward.
Mike Vrabel and the Patriots are 11-2 so far this season.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan December 5, 2025 | 12:56 PM 5 minutes to read After a quiet trade deadline in Foxborough, Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel preached patience amid a successful start to the 2025 campaign.

title: Harvard professor charged with firing pellet gun outside Brookline temple arrested by ICE
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News Federal officials described the incident as an “anti-Semitic shooting,” contrary to statements from local authorities and Temple Beth Zion leadership.
In this Thursday, Dec.
5, 2019, photo, passersby walk near an entrance to a building at Harvard Law School, in Cambridge, Mass.

title: Former Celtics lead owner Wyc Grousbeck reportedly drops $58 million on Hamptons mansion
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: Luxury Homes The eight-bed, nine-bath mansion boasts 125 feet of direct ocean frontage.
Wyc Grousbeck is selling his majority stake in the Celtics after a tenure that has included two championships.

title: 2026 FIFA World Cup draw live updates: Find out who the U.S. and other nations will face in the group stage
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: World Cup The 12 four-nation "Groups" will be determined on Friday.
The schedule (and specifically who will come to Gillette Stadium for the first round of the tournament) will be announced on Saturday.
The FIFA World Cup Trophy on display at the playoff draw in November.

title: ‘I be forgetting what happened on offense’: Even on career night, Jordan Walsh only remembers his defensive plays
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics "When I score, I low-key forget what happened.
I'm so focused on getting back on defense.
" Jordan Walsh finishes dunk on his way to dropping 22 points against the Wizards (John McDonnell/AP Photo).

title: Person injured by falling concession sign near Fenway Park, police say
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The man was taken to a local hospital Thursday with a head laceration, according to Boston police.
Jersey Street, pictured in 2020.

AP Photo/Michael Dwyer, File By Abby Patkin December 5, 2025 | 10:55 AM 1 minute to read A man was sent to the hospital with a head injury Thursday night after he was struck by a sign that fell from a concession stand outside Fenway Park, according to Boston police.

title: Victim allegedly hit with glass bottle, put in headlock during Dorchester robbery
author: John Waller
bullets: Crime Officers arrested a 38-year-old woman but were unable to locate a second suspect.
By John Waller December 5, 2025 | 10:38 AM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A 38-year-old woman was arrested Wednesday after a victim flagged down police in Dorchester and told them he was struck in the head with a glass bottle and put in a headlock during a robbery.
